casebody.data:
Barberic, Appellant, v. Catholic Diocese of Cleveland et al., Appellees.

[Cite as Barberic v. Catholic Diocese of Cleveland (2001), 91 Ohio St.3d 1235.]

(No. 00-1067 Submitted February 7, 2001 Decided March 28, 2001.)

The cause is dismissed, sua sponte, as having been improvidently allowed.

Moyer, C.J., Douglas, Resnick, F.E. Sweeney, Pfeifer, Cook and Lundberg Stratton, JJ., concur. *1236Nurenberg, Plevin, Heller & McCarthy Co., L.P.A., David M. Paris, Kathleen J. St. John and Brenda M. Johnson, for appellant. Edward J. Maher, for appellees Catholic Diocese of Cleveland and Most Reverend Anthony M. Pilla William T. Doyle, for appellee Father Gary Berthiuame. William T. Monroe, for appellee Father Allen F. Bruening. Bonezzi, Switzer, Murphy & Polito Co., L.P.A., Beth A. Sebaugh and Patrick J. Quallich, for appellees Ascension Catholic Church and Ascension School. Betty D. Montgomery, Attorney General, and Robert C. Maier, Assistant Attorney General, urging reversal for amicus curiae, Ohio Attorney General.
